data.best-practices#Best Practices: Keep It Simple: Use Markdown for its simplicity. Avoid overcomplicating your documents. Use Consistent Formatting: Stick to one style for headings, lists, and other elements. Preview Your Work: Always preview your Markdown to ensure it renders correctly. Use Comments Sparingly: Markdown doesn’t support comments, but some processors allow HTML comments ().
data.blockquotes#Blockquotes:
Blockquotes are created by adding a > before the text.
> This is a blockquote. > > This is another line in the blockquote.
data.bold-and-italic#Bold and Italic: Bold: Wrap text with ** or __. Italic: Wrap text with * or _. **This is bold text** __This is also bold text__ *This is italic text* _This is also italic text_ **_This is bold and italic text_**
data.code#Code:
Inline code: Wrap text with `. Code blocks: Wrap text with ``` or indent with four spaces. This is `inline code`. This is a code block.
This is also a code block.
data.expandable--collapsible-sections#Expanda: Click to expand Hidden content goes here.
data.footnotes#Footnotes:
Add footnotes using [^label] and define them at the bottom of the document.
Here is a footnote reference[^1]. [^1]: This is the footnote.
data.headings#Headings:
Headings are created by adding one or more # symbols before the heading text. The number of # symbols corresponds to the heading level.
# Heading 1 ## Heading 2 ### Heading 3 #### Heading 4 ##### Heading 5 ###### Heading 6
data.highlighting#Highlighting:
Wrap text with == to highlight it.
This is ==highlighted text==. This is a marked text
data.horizontal-rules#Horizontal Rules:
Create a horizontal rule by using three or more -, *, or _ characters.
--- *** ___
data.markdown-editors-and-tools#Markdown Edit:
Here are some popular Markdown editors and tools:
Obsidian: The most widely used & loved markdown editor Visual Studio Code: A powerful code editor with Markdown support. Typora: A minimalistic Markdown editor with live preview. Markdown Here: A browser extension for writing Markdown in emails. Dillinger: An online Markdown editor. Pandoc: A universal document converter that supports Markdown.
data.markdown-tutorial#Markdown Tutorial:
Markdown TutorialMarkdown is a lightweight markup language that you can use to add formatting elements to plaintext text documents. Created by John Gruber in 2004, Markdown is now one of the world’s most popular markup languages. It is widely used for formatting readme files, writing messages in online discussion forums, and creating rich text using a plain text editor.
This tutorial will cover everything you need to know about Markdown, from basic syntax to advanced features. Let’s dive in!
data.ordered-lists#Ordered Lists:
Use numbers followed by a period to create ordered lists.
8. First item 9. Second item 10. Subitem 2.1 11. Subitem 2.2 12. Third item
data.paragraphs-and-line-breaks#Paragraphs an:
To create a paragraph, leave a blank line between lines of text. To create a line break, end a line with two or more spaces.
This is a paragraph. This is another paragraph. This is a new line in the same paragraph.
data.strikethrough#Strikethrough:
Wrap text with ~~ to create strikethrough text.
~~This is strikethrough text.~~
data.subscript-and-superscript#Subscript and:
Subscript: Wrap text with ~. Superscript: Wrap text with ^. H~2~O E = mc^2^ HTML subscript & superscript tag also supported:
H2O E = mc2
data.tables#Tables:
Create tables using | and -.
| Column 1 | Column 2 | Column 3 | |----------|----------|----------| | Row 1 | Data 1 | Data 2 | | Row 2 | Data 3 | Data 4 |
data.task-lists#Task Lists:
Create task lists using - [ ] for incomplete tasks and - [x] for completed tasks.
- [x] Task 1 - [ ] Task 2 - [ ] Task 3
data.underline#Underline:
Markdown doesn’t have built-in syntax for underline, but it can be achieved by html or tag.
An underlined text also an underlined text
data.unordered-lists#Unordered Lists:
Use -, *, or + to create unordered lists.
- Item 1 - Item 2 - Subitem 2.1 - Subitem 2.2 * Item 3 + Item 4

data.installation#Installation:
This is the first step.
sudo dnf install hugo
